comments.body: Unfortunate that you have to hardcode just two fields.  This would be a lot more useful if it traversed all maps.
the trouble is that this is bytes, we could automatically build up a map for every runtime.Object I suppose.  Follow on PR?
I can't think of a way to improve it, just noting that we really want a SAX / streaming parser here.
@nikhiljindal @pwittrock I think you guys know this file-- is this a good way to fix the problem?

If the aim is just to prevent panic, then we can also return nil here instead of returning an error?
args is an optional field so its fine for it to be null?

Hi @nikhiljindal , thanks for the review.

So I tried returning a success (empty error list) then ran a hacked version of "blog-logging". The user gets a rather poor error:

```
./kubectl.sh create -f ../examples/blog-logging/counter-pod.yaml 
unable to decode "../examples/blog-logging/counter-pod.yaml": [pos 94]: json: expect char '"' but got char 'n'
```

Instead of the following:

```
./kubectl.sh create -f ../examples/blog-logging/counter-pod.yaml 
error validating "../examples/blog-logging/counter-pod.yaml": error validating data: unexpected nil value for field spec.containers[0].args[0]; if you choose to ignore these errors, turn validation off with --validate=false
```
This would double validate `List`, right?
yeah, and fail like it does today when the model isn't found for that type
Any reason to continue after the end of this `if`?
Please give examples of what this regexp should and shouldn't match. (in a test?)
And why does the old mechanism no longer work?
It's because an experimental type may have a v1 type as a field, so `strings.HasPrefix(fieldType, apiVersion)` returns false when it should return true.
Can you give an example?

like this https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/apis/experimental/v1/types.go#L205

and during the validation, the old mechanism will check `strings.HasPrefix(v1.PodTemplateSpec, v1alpha1)`, so it will return a false. But we should take this if condition and recursively cal ValidateObject as v1.PodTemplateSpec is a type defined by us.

Do you mean I should give an example in the comments?

I don't get it-- that field should be called "template" by the swagger?

On Mon, Sep 21, 2015 at 3:33 PM, Chao Xu notifications@github.com wrote:

> In pkg/api/validation/schema.go
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/14156#discussion_r40035221
> :
> 
> >  func (s *SwaggerSchema) validateField(value interface{}, apiVersion, fieldName, fieldType string, fieldDetails *swagger.ModelProperty) errs.ValidationErrorList {
> > -   if strings.HasPrefix(fieldType, apiVersion) {
> > -   // TODO: caesarxuchao: because we have multiple group/versions and objects
> > -   // may reference objects in other group, the commented out way of checking
> > -   // if a filedType is a type defined by us is outdated. We use a hacky way
> > -   // for now.
> 
> like this
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/apis/experimental/v1/types.go#L205
> 
> and during the validation, the old mechanism will check strings.HasPrefix(v1.PodTemplateSpec,
> v1alpha1), so it will return a false. But we should take this if
> condition and recursively cal ValidateObject as v1.PodTemplateSpec is a
> type defined by us.
> 
> Do you mean I should give an example in the comments?
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/14156/files#r40035221.
why not use  runtime.UnstructuredJSONScheme.DataVersionAndKind for this?
err := json.Unmarshal(data, &obj), this already parses json package, I think we can't add an new unmarshal call, so I don't use runtime.UnstructuredJSONScheme.DataVersionAndKind. what's your point?
DataVersionAndKind does exactly this. It would be cleaner to use DataVersionAndKind but less efficient. Just entertaining the idea.

can you switch to

```
yaml "gopkg.in/yaml.v2"
```

It makes some tools happier.
@thockin I seem to recall you wanting this change in a few places but I can't recall why?

Not me, sorry.

wrote:

done.
Is this called from anywhere besides the test?
Not right now, but it will be called from kubecfg/kubectl.
